intro: Microcorys brevidens, commonly known as the short-armed microcorys, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate flowers and hairy stems. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic study.
